page.title: 01LANGPORT - AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: { }A small, rural town equi-distant from Taunton, Yeovil and Bridgwater.Shops and houses form a narrow causeway linking two higher areas in the south of the Somerset Levels. The Hill is the oldest part of the town and gives good views of the surrounding district. Two rivers meet south of Langport, in Huish Episcopi; the Parrett and the Yeo.Low lying moorland is subject to flooding in Winter but pumping stations have alleviated this problem. Langport is a smaller parish than its neighbour Huish Episcopi although it is better known. There is a large variety of building materials (limestone, blue lias, hamstone and brick) and styles of architecture.
